isis.stitle: International® MaxxForce™ DT, 9 and 10 Engine Service Manual - Cylinder Head and Valve Train - Installation - Torque Procedure for Torque-to-yield Head Bolts

svcproc.title: Torque Procedure for Torque-to-yield Head Bolts

step1.para: Rotate crankshaft to TDC for Cylinder 1. Then rotate crankshaft 30 degrees past TDC.
Tighten each cylinder head bolt to 150 N·m (110 lbf·ft) in cylinder head torque sequence A.
Tighten each cylinder head bolt to 204 N·m (150 lbf·ft) in cylinder head torque sequence A.
Tighten each cylinder head bolt again to 204 N·m (150 lbf·ft) in cylinder head torque sequence B.

note.para: It is necessary to torque cylinder head bolts twice at 204 N·m (150 lbf·ft) in order to obtain uniform head bolt torque.

calloutgroup.callout1: Top of head bolt before Torque-to-Yield
Top of head bolt after Torque-to-Yield

caution.para: To prevent engine damage, use permanent marker to identify internal engine components and their orientation. Do not use paint or temporary markers.

step1.para:
Using a permanent marker, place a mark on each head bolt and put another mark on the head bolt socket
directly in line with the mark on each head bolt.
Put a mark on the cylinder head surface 90° clockwise from each head bolt mark.
Install head bolt socket on head bolt to be torqued and align mark on socket with the mark on the head bolt.

Torque-to-yield each cylinder head bolt by rotating bolt 90 degrees clockwise (1/4 turn) in cylinder head torque sequence B. The marks on the head bolt socket, head bolt, and cylinder head surface should be aligned.
